content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: DSTERM
      operator: equal_to
      value: COMPLETED
    - name: DSDECOD
      operator: not_equal_to
      value: COMPLETED
Core:
  Id: CORE-000033
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Raise an error when DSTERM = "COMPLETED" and DSDECOD not equal to "COMPLETED".
Outcome:
  Message: DSDECOD is not equal to "COMPLETED" when DSTERM equals "COMPLETED".
  Output Variables:
    - DSTERM
    - DSDECOD
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0065
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: When DSTERM = "COMPLETED", DSDECOD is the term "COMPLETED"
                  from the controlled terminology codelist NCOMPLT.
                Document: SDTMIG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 3.b.i.
                Section: 6.2.3
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.3'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0065
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: b. When DSTERM = 'COMPLETED', DSDECOD = 'COMPLETED'.
                Document: SDTMIG v3.3
                Item: Assumption 3b
                Section: 6.2.3
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.2'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0065
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: b. When DSTERM = 'COMPLETED', DSDECOD = 'COMPLETED'.
                Document: SDTMIG v3.2
                Item: Assumption 3b
                Section: '6.2'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - EVENTS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - DS

json.Description: Raise an error when DSTERM = "COMPLETED" and DSDECOD not equal to "COMPLETED".

Outcome.Message: DSDECOD is not equal to "COMPLETED" when DSTERM equals "COMPLETED".

Citations.Cited_Guidance: When DSTERM = "COMPLETED", DSDECOD is the term "COMPLETED" from the controlled terminology codelist NCOMPLT.
